title: Yemen: Protecting sheep and goats against disease

tasks.task: Placing fertilizer into a tractor's tank
subtasks: Identify the proper fertilizer to use
Measure the required amount of fertilizer
Transport the fertilizer to the tractor
Open the tractor's tank hatch
Carefully pour the fertilizer into the tank
Close the tractor's tank hatch securely
Starting the tractor's engine
Adjusting the tractor's speed as needed
Navigating the tractor through fields
Monitoring the tractor's fuel level during operation

tasks.task: Attaching a fertilizer spreader to the tractor
subtasks: Position the spreader behind the tractor
Securely fasten the spreader to the tractor's drawbar
Activate the spreader mechanism
Check for proper spreader calibration
Ensuring the spreader is adjusted to the correct fertilizer width and drop spacing
Adjusting overall spreader settings as necessary
Beginning the application process, starting from one end of the field
Gradually moving the tractor along the field
Stopping periodically to check and reset the spreader
Completing the fertilizer application on the field

tasks.task: Cleaning and maintaining the spreader after use
subtasks: Shutting off the spreader mechanism
Disconnecting the spreader from the tractor
Moving the spreader and tractor to a storage area
Inspecting the spreader for damage or wear
Lubricating moving parts
Storing the spreader properly until next use
Recording the type and amount of fertilizer used
Noting the application date
Checking weather conditions on the day of application
Ensuring compliance with agricultural regulations
